thread.title: Christmas theatre, fine eatery and literary festival: The best things to do this week
thread.title_full: Christmas theatre, fine eatery and literary festival: The best things to do this week

title: Christmas theatre, fine eatery and literary festival: The best things to do this week
text:
Christmas theatre, fine eatery and literary festival: The best things to do this week Christmas theatre, fine eatery and literary festival: The best things to do this week A MAGICAL journey to see Santa, a literary festival, a fashionable eaterie and a fairy-tale ballet will cast their spell this week. PUBLISHED: PUBLISHED: 00:01, Sun, Oct 11, 2015 PH 
Go to 
In the middle of London’s fashionable Knightsbridge, The Rib Room Bar & Restaurant offers fine fare at bargain prices. On the menu are juicy steaks and vegetarian dishes, served up by staff who couldn’t be friendlier and knowledgeable sommeliers (there are 400 wines to choose from). 
The eaterie is adorned by expressionist art by well-known Polish-born artist Feliks Topolski and there’s live music on selected week nights. Gin is a speciality, but our favourite is the Manhattan Perfect. Find it at the Jumeirah Carlton Tower, Cadogan Place. Visit theribroom.co.uk for more details. PH 
Watch 
Ballet lovers will adore the enchanting revival of Matthew Bourne’s Sleeping Beauty: A Gothic Romance on Saturday at the Theatre Royal Plymouth. Bourne’s re-imagined Tchaikovsky ballet stars Dominic North and Ashley Shaw. 
The UK tour will end on April 30, 2016. An eight-week season at London’s Sadler’s Wells starts on December 1. Visit new-adventures.net/sleeping-beauty . PH 
Visit 
Join bestselling authors at the annual Dulwich Literary Festival next week for three fun-packed days of creative workshops and readings. The festival opens in Dulwich College on Friday with former Business Secretary Vince Cable discussing his economic page-turner After The Storm. 
Other talks feature Prue Leith (below) on her new novel, The Food Of Love, and broadcaster Huw Edwards on his new book City Mission. Tickets start at £5. See dulwichliteraryfestival.co.uk . PH 
Book 
Capture all the enchantment of Christmas by treating the family to a Lapland adventure at home. Santa’s magical Arctic homeland returns to Berkshire’s Whitmoor Forest on the Windsor Estate on November 21. 
The award-winning immersive theatre experience LaplandUK offers families a journey through Santa’s home to meet his elves and animals, decorate gingerbread with Mother Christmas, dance on the ice rink and, of course, meet Father Christmas himself. For details, see laplanduk.co.uk . Related articles
